page.title: Others
page.keywords: wiki, roblox bus simulator, roblox bus sim, roblox bus sim others

items.listItemDescription: There are billboards in the game that appears on the sides of the road around every 3 minutes and 30 seconds. The billboards showcase real advertisements to companies, such as H&M and Nike, for example. These billboards can only be seen if your account age is 13+, as they cannot be advertised to people if they are 12 or younger.
The Radio is a functional prop in The Bus in Bus Simulator. It plays a large variety of songs and intermissions around the bus, and can be listened to via Airpods.
The Bus-Cola Bandolier is an official accessory that you can buy here. This accessory currently has no functional usage yet and can be worn anywhere even outside of Bus Simulator.
Commands are a feature in Bus Simulator used to change small elements of the game, such as chat tag customisation and private server commands.

In Bus Simulator, there are currently six cosmetics in the game, and they are exclusive to a specific player. While the page will not list their ROBLOX username, we will show the cosmetics, and what they go by online. The cosmetics can also be seen in Kit Battle.

The D.I.Y. Minibus is an official accessory that you can buy here. The accessory, if worn in-game, will change colors based off of what color you set with !color if you have the Mini-Bus gamepass. Otherwise it'll act as a normal waist accessory in any other game on Roblox.

In Bus Simulator, you are able to play smaller games while waiting for events to arise mostly thanks to both the Gameboy Advance, and the RoEmulator, while three of them are locked behind a paywall, you can still have extra fun while waiting between events on the bus.

The GPS lists locations that the Bus is currently in, and this is the list that shows most of them. They're all just cosmetic, and have no correlation to the biome you're in. There are 396 locations so far in this list (excluding "Recalculating.." and event-exclusive locations [e.g. 2648 Goat Ave Goat Station], including Routes [e.g. Route 27]). If you find a location that isn't on this list, feel free to add one to this list by editing this page!
If you play Bus Simulator during December 30th and 31st, you can get free stuff every hour to celebrate new years.

News, or called News Articles or News Reporter, is a chat feature in Bus Simulator. Every so often, it would report on something to make chat much less empty aside from shouts. This also references a few different things including NPCs, shows, and more. There may also be scripted news, which only appear if given the right conditions.

The No Sleep badge is the last one of a trio of badge (The first other 2 being The "Pretty Fun" and "Addicted" ) that are all about spending a certain amount of time on a server non-stop. The badge is obtained by staying on a server for a whole day (24 hours) without leaving it at anytime.

The pearcoin is a gamepass that is only obtainable through Pear, or through somebody's inventory, and costs 2 R$ to purchase. The item doesn't appear in your inventory. All the pearcoin does is give you extra dialogues for Frostbite, Pear, and Disc. The gamepass is meant to be an "investment", but is actually just a scam, like cryptocurrency. You can only have one pearcoin at a time. If you show the pearcoin to Frostbite, he will immediately gain your trust (if you give him an Ice Cream before, however.)
There's a small handful of chat tags in the game that you can obtain by simple means, with some either being permanent or temporary. This page will go over them, and give short explanations of them.

Reputation (or more commonly known as 'rep') is a statistic in Bus Simulator that works either as collection for milestones like as heart tags, or currency for permanent items, and it also has two different forms, both of which can be obtained in different ways.
The Television, or TV for short, is an interactive prop that appears both in The Bus and Noble's House.
In Bus Simulator, when you have vehicles enabled by default in the Performance Settings (On by default.), vehicles will spawn in the road besides the bus..

VR is a method of playing for all Roblox games, with varying degrees of compatibility. For Bus Simulator, VR is mostly compatible with little to no hinderance, and even offers you a few perks for playing with a headset.
The weather is a visual feature in Bus Simulator that has zero impact to the game-play, but adds both visuals and sounds depending on what weather is currently active as you wait for the next event.
